intro: Onosmodium carolinianum var. molle, commonly known as the softleaf onosmodium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
